parameters: \pop[2]We all sit around the table, exchanging satisfied glances.
\pop[2]I guess that was the end of our campaign. At least, our little "test" campaign.
But I thought you wanted to avoid a cliffhanger.
Besides, we answered a major question.
So for me? That's enough resolution.
Definitely fit the tone and style of everything.
\pop[4]Nice little twist at the end, too.
I mean - my father was the leader of The Thorns?
\pop[3]I thought I'd triple down on the irony.
Gotta feel bad for your character, though.
\pop[4]Well, he did what he had to do; just like he always does.
At least now he has closure on something that haunted him forever.
\pop[3]It's kinda cool how this all lined up with our own world, too.
\pop[3]Well, our rebellion took down The Triumvirate, right?
They were clearly evil, so we changed the world for the better.
\pop[3]But there was a power struggle between us and The Thorns.
If we continue the story, I imagine they'd be the first of many.
\pop[4]Oh, I see what you're getting at.
If we treat \c[10]Argus\c[0] like The Triumvirate, the result could be the same.
Competitors will rise up, taking advantage of the gap in power.
But I imagine in our world, the competition won't be as underhanded.
\pop[4]We'll probably just see new companies rise up.
Each one with their own unique identity, and benefits.
But they'll all be tied to \c[10]The System\c[0], not just \c[10]Argus\c[0].
\pop[4]Do you think \c[10]Argus\c[0] is using \c[10]The System\c[0] to their own end?
\pop[4]If they were, it was probably in the name of the greater good.
Even \c[14]I\c[0] agree that \c[17]Komorebi\c[0] requires some level of social control.
\pop[4]But not \c[14]nearly\c[0] as much as they've led us to believe.
They're using fear of the unknown as a weapon.
\pop[4]I'm loving all these parallels between real life and our campaign.
Makes it seem like Taylor actually took time to plan all this.
Remember, you baited me into doing this.
If I let down the storyteller of the group, I'd be crushed.
Even connected Isaac's backstory to the overall narrative.
It makes the conclusion a lot more satisfying.
Without a strong foundation, everything just falls apart.
\pop[3]And calling them threads is a metaphor, right?
\pop[4]Kinda. You want all your threads to be as strong as possible.
We all know what happens when you tug on a loose one.
\pop[4]It's pretty cool when you think about it, right?
Isaac is part of a rebellion, just like the characters in our campaign were.
\pop[4]And because we've got his back, we're members too.
But I'm gonna say we're "unwilling accomplices".
We can help Isaac change the world, here.
If we were gonna lose, it would've been ages ago.
\pop[3]Probably as soon as he applied Kyron's identity to that phone.
\pop[3]You mean whatever you're planning at their HQ \c[14]isn't\c[0] risky?
Just not as much as you'd think.
\pop[4]It's been smooth sailing so far, and I aim to keep it that way.
\pop[4]If you're starting to doubt things, just look at the town square.
\pop[4]City folk have started feeding and hanging out with the \c[23]zeros\c[0].
Both sides are now part of the protest.
Everyone was worried about stepping in, and getting in trouble.
But it's not happening, so it's just inspiring \c[14]more\c[0] people to help.
\pop[4]Our entire journey has been filled with worry, sure.
But it was always worry about what \c[14]could\c[0] happen.
It's never been based on what \c[14]has\c[0] happened.
\pop[4]And each day that passes? More stuff keeps happening.
Our concerns have been put to rest, almost every single day.
\pop[4]So it's time to start basing our thoughts on reality.
We can't let them use fear of the unknown against us.
Remember, that's always been their most valuable weapon.
Maybe we should've made \c[14]you\c[0] The Monarch.
\pop[2]We all smile, as our time with the campaign comes to an end.
\pop[2]But with it, came striking similiarities to our current situation.
\pop[2]Similiarities that fill me with resolve, rather than fear.
\pop[2]I remember thinking up some similarities when we first started.
\pop[2]But back then, so much was uncertain...
\pop[2]It's impressive how far we've come in such a short time.
\pop[2]Isaac telling us about his link to \c[23]Cipher\c[0] seemed to unite us even \c[14]more\c[0].
\pop[2]I gotta say, being an Agent of \c[23]Cipher\c[0] sounds pretty awesome.
\pop[2]We're going to witness the end of \c[10]Argus\c[0]' monopoly, \c[14]and\c[0] the aftermath.
\pop[2]If \c[23]Cipher\c[0] is like The Rebellion, then they'd rise up after this all ends.
\pop[2]If only Dante knew how much irony was behind this statement...
\pop[2]Isaac should be The Monarch? Well, he technically was.
\pop[2]He's running \c[23]Cipher\c[0] much like how I ran The Rebellion, and The Monarchy.
\pop[2]And just like me, he was \c[14]uniquely\c[0] qualified to take on the task.
\pop[2]His entire life has led up to this Sunday.
\pop[2]Thankfully, there's no one I'd trust more than him.
\pop[2]\c[14]Especially\c[0] when it came to bringing us a better future...
